# This will reset the BMC to switch to new backup image.

Can you give a better name here:
May be like:
Switch Backup Firmware Image To Functional
I will reply left over comment in sperate patch.

Why this parameter is required?
Without version number, we can't switch?

-> using image version as parameter for this keyword as redfish URI need the firmware version which needs to be switched i.e. "/redfish/v1/UpdateService/FirmwareInventory/image_version"

-> user will have a control as which image need to be switched.

-> version number needed as to specify which version needs to be switched.

There will be one functional and one backup image on BMC, right?
Keyword can get the version of backup image, it can pick it and change it.
If any user wants to use this keyword to change backup to functional, why he has to go and check system, instead keyword will pick backup and make it functional.

Initial it was used to support single image and later it has supported two images.

As per your suggestion "to do" in this keyword with out passing image version as parameter.

1. Get the back up image details.
2. Using redfish URI change to back Image. 
3. Verify the backup image is functional.

yes, this could also be solution to make back up image as functional.

In current implementation, passing the Image version gives a control to user as which image need to be functional when there are more than two images are available. So, by considering this scenario I implemented this keyword with passing parameter as image version.
if only one backup image, then it does not make sense to enter image version. do you know there will be support for multiple backup images? Is there any requirement for multiple backup images?
Can the functional n backup version be same on BMC?
No, both i.e. functional/backup image can not have same image version.
when they both will never be same, validation is not required for making backup to functional.

From where you importing this keyword
actually this keyword in redfish/extended/redfish_bmc_code_update.robot test suite.
you can't use this keyword either you need to define this keyword in the Resource file
redfish/extended/redfish_bmc_code_update.robot will move the keywords in common file. will push the changes in anoyher parch

Yeah, that code should go before this goes in.
Can you Pls move it common place where it is available to this test case.
below patch is for moving the common keyword.(https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/#/c/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/+/38839/)

From where you importing this keyword
actually this keyword in redfish/extended/redfish_bmc_code_update.robot test suite.
you can't use this keyword either you need to define this keyword in the Resource file
why do we need this ? doesnt the bellow does it ?
this will give only BMC firmware details, in below keyword will give BMC+host .
unable to see new changes in Patchset 12
can you verify image versions after change to backup image and reset the BMC ?
Switch Backup Firmware Image To Functional - this keyword is created to perform only switch the backup firmware image to make functional.
